label: Description
value: Rectangular shaped body with rounded corners, both sides cut in with rectangular panel of small diamonds in oval border, fan flutes at ends, fluting around edges; threaded neck, glass stopper, silver cap.

label: Description

label: Provenance
value: Howard Phillips, London; 1967 Phelps Warren NY

label: Description
value: Small, octagonal dish with low, flaring sides. All-over crossent diamond pattern. Scalloped rim. Glass is heavy and white.

label: Description
value: Round body tapering to tall neck with evented lip and pouring spout, loop handle; band of wide flute cut around bottom of sides, above, a row of horizontal and vertical narrow fluting, wide flutings continue up to lip through 3 neck rings; handle cut with notches and thumb piece, mushroom shaped stopper with radial flutes cut on top, facets on stem.

label: Provenance
value: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

value: Pear-shaped body, cut with drapery swags and flat vertical flutes; silver- plated cap with perforations

label: Provenance
value: W. G. T. Burne, London; 1983 WPW

label: Description
value: Small, inverted pear-shaped bowl with flat bottom, short stem with flattened globular knop and broad, circular foot. Wheel engraved on upper part of bowl with alternating sprays and stars in groups of 4. Below, one ring and row of small hatch marks encircle bowl.

label: Provenance
value: Tower Hous Antiques, (angus MacDonald), Bangor, Northern Ireland

label: Description

label: Description

label: Provenance
value: W.G.T. Burne, London; 8 July 1971: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
